org.javalite.templator

Interface BuiltIn

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Esc

    public interface BuiltIn
    This interface is implemented by classes that need to do additional processing of strings during a template merge. For instance: ${article.text esc} where esc is a name of a built-in registered with a name "esc".

    Think of a built-in as a function that will do the last minute formatting of a value before merging it into a template.

    Subclasses must be stateless.
    Author:
    Igor Polevoy on 1/15/15.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String process(String input)
      Will manipulate input.

    • Method Detail

      • process

        String process(String input)
        Will manipulate input. The returned value is the one ultimately displayed in a template. For instance here: ${article.text esc} the value article.text, esc is a name of a built-in and a returned value from a built-in is merged into template.
        Parameters:
        input - value passed to template for merging
        Returns:
        value passed to template for merging after processing by this built-in
